create_redstone_additions.ponder.diode.t: A Diode passes the signal when cyan quartz anode is facing the power source, but unlike a repeater, does not refresh it.
When reversed, rose quartz cathode is facing the signal direction thus, blocking it.
create_redstone_additions.ponder.conjunc: Conjunctor activates if it receives a signal from both right and left.
Fully activated when both sides provide a signal.
create_redstone_additions.ponder.disjunc: Disjunctor activates if it receives a signal from any side.
Signal from left side is enough...
Signal from right side is also enough...
Disjunctor stays deactivated if no signal is received from either side.
Activated if either side provides a signal.
create_redstone_additions.ponder.inverte: Inverter always emits a signal as long as there is no redstone input from its opposite side.
create_redstone_additions.ponder.crossro: The Crossroad bridges a redstone signal in one specific direction and that direction only.
It prevents redstone signals from spreading in all directions when wires intersect.
Only the east–west redstone flow is deactivated. North–south remains unaffected.
Now only the north–south redstone flow is deactivated. East–west remains unaffected.
With the crossroad, flow of redstone signals is independent across opposite directions. Use it wisely!
create_redstone_additions.ponder.resisto: Resistors reduce the power of a redstone signal depending on the type.
Golden resistor reduces redstone power by 1.
Iron resistor reduces redstone power by 2.
Ceramic resistor reduces redstone power by 5.
Glass resistor reduces redstone power by 10.
